Package org.xmlresolver

Class ResourceResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xmlresolver.ResolvedResource
      • org.xmlresolver.ResourceResponse
  • public class ResourceResponse
extends ResolvedResource
    Encapsulates the response to a resource request.

      • getRequest

        public ResourceRequest getRequest()
        What request generated this response?

        As a convenience, you can get back the request for which this response was constructed.

        Specified by:
        getRequest in class ResolvedResource
        Returns:
        the originating request

      • getResolvedURI

        public java.net.URI getResolvedURI()
        Get the resolved URI
        Specified by:
        getResolvedURI in class ResolvedResource
        Returns:
        the resolved URI, or null if the resolution failed. See also getLocalURI().

      • getLocalURI

        public java.net.URI getLocalURI()
        Get the local version of the resolved URI.

        The resolved URI and the local URI are usually the same. But if the resolved URI is masked (for example, if it's a jar: or classpath: URI and the ResolverFeature.MASK_JAR_URIS feature is enabled, the resolved URI will be the original request URI (made absolute). The local URI will be the underlying jar: or classpath: URI.

        Specified by:
        getLocalURI in class ResolvedResource
        Returns:
        the local URI

      • getHeaders

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getHeaders()
        Returns headers associated with the response
        Overrides:
        getHeaders in class ResolvedResource
        Returns:
        the headers or an empty map if no headers are available.

      • getHeader

        public java.lang.String getHeader​(java.lang.String name)
        Return the (first) header with the specified name.

        This is a convenience method partly because header names are case-insensitive. Returns only the first value, or null if there are no values.

        Specified by:
        getHeader in class ResolvedResource
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the header whose value should be returned.
        Returns:
        the value of the first header with the specified name
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if name is null

        Specified by:

      • getContentType

        public java.lang.String getContentType()
        Get the content type of the resource
        Specified by:
        getContentType in class ResolvedResource
        Returns:
        the content type or null if the content type is not known

      • getEncoding

        public java.lang.String getEncoding()
        Get the encoding of the resource

        Extracts the encoding from the content type header, if possible. Returns null if the encoding is unknown. Note that an XML resource may have an encoding declaration, but that is not used by this method.

        Specified by:
        getEncoding in class ResolvedResource
        Returns:
        the encoding, or null if the encoding is unknown

      • getStatusCode

        public int getStatusCode()
        Get the response status code

        For successful resolution to file: resources, the code is set to 200 for consistency with http: (and https:).

        Overrides:
        getStatusCode in class ResolvedResource
        Returns:
        the status code, or -1 if it's unknown or unavailable.
